newsitem.title: GERMANY: Lufthansa Cargo makes Dm48.2mln H1 loss.
newsitem.headline: Lufthansa Cargo makes Dm48.2mln H1 loss.

text.p: Lufthansa Cargo AG(LCAG) made a half-year loss of 48.2 million marks, including a second quarter loss of 3.5 million marks, the Lufthansa in-house newspaper Lufthanseat said.
LCAG, the autonomous cargo arm of Deutsche Lufthansa AG, said on August 15 it would record a 1996 half-year loss in the 45-50 million marks range.

Lufthansa Cargo spokesman Dietrich Seidl said he could not comment on the figures at present, adding that the airline would first publish official half-year results in a shareholders' report due in late August.
The company made a half-year pre-tax profit of 2.8 million marks last year and a full-year profit of 20.4 million marks.
Half-year earnings dropped one percent to 1.6 billion marks and the airline's cargo load factor also fell one percent to 68.1 percent, the newspaper said added.
Higher cargo volumes were not able to compensate for an average yield fall generated by an increased market capacity and strong rates pressure, it saidthe report noted.
The Asia/Pacific region suffered revenue problems in particular, it said.
Expenditure on fuel and airport charges rose compared to first-half 1995 although by less than budgeted for, the newspaper said.
